    • Method Detail

      • setMatcher

        public void setMatcher(Matcher m)
        Set a matcher to match individual elements. This facility was added so that we could evaluate things like if a given DTO had a condition x match on column X, else match on column Y.
        Parameters:
        m - the matcher that evaluates individual elements.

      • filterData

        public void filterData(DataResult dr,
              java.lang.String filterData,
              java.lang.String filterColumn)
        There are some preconditions We expect each element of DataResult to implement "DepthAware". The depth value has to be >=0 with 0 being the root depth. We need this keep track of the parents. Another assumption is that the list is ordered depthwise For example A data result with - {(C1,0), (C2,1), (C3,2), (C4,1), (C5,2), (D1,0), (D2,1), (D3,1), (E1,0), (E2,1), (E3,1) } will resemble the following tree ( Note - In our notation (X,Y), the X = content while Y = depth, while 2nd is a unique id) C1 D1 E1 / \ / \ / \ C2 C4 D2 D3 E2 E3 / \ C3 C5
        Specified by:
        filterData in interface ResultsFilter
        Parameters:
        dr - DataResult to be filtered
        filterData - String to filter the DataResult with
        filterColumn - column to filter on

      • handleOrphans

        protected void handleOrphans(DataResult result)
        Handle the unavailable channels/systems by adding fake nodes.
        Parameters:
        result - list of nodes to solve
